intro: Adinandra urdanetensis, commonly known as the Urdanet mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers with five petals, typically in shades of red or pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
